channel.title: [PI] Help
channel.description:
Alright, I'm trying to make a ::item command, but how do I make it so It can't spawn certain items and have it so normal people can spawn?
Also, How do I delete unwanted customs?
All of this will be rewarded..

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

I actually had to just make my own. But here is what I got, and it works like a bute.

[code] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”)) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20500) && (newItemID >= 0)) {

if (newItemID == #### || newItemID == #### || newItemID == ####) {
c.sendMessage(“This item is unspawnable.”);
return;
}
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“That item ID does not exist.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Wrong usage: (Ex:(::pickup_ID_Amount)(::item 995 1))”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			}
			}[/code]

Where the ‘####’ are, just add your item id’s.

As for making all players able to spawn, just search for a command that all players can type, something like ::players, and add it after the last } in the command. That’s the lazy way to do it at least.

As for the customs, I can’t help. Sorry. Hope I helped with everything else though.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Help
item.dc:creator: @Web_developer Web developer
item.description:
@Web_developer wrote:

[quote=“runewings317, post:4, topic:409401”][quote author=Web developer link=topic=510685.msg3705898#msg3705898 date=1313029130]

Make an int that contains item id’s that you don’t want them to spawn. Deleting custom items is client sided, class8 (ItemDef if Galkon). Master you can either make it give you 14m xp on each seperate line, or you can make it like for (int i : i < 25) { addSkillXP[i] += 14000000;}

that’s a bad example, but it’s something like that… ::pure you would have it like addSkillXP[#] += 14000000; for the skills you want to level up.

I know that but how do I make all those commands for player’s its under staff and there isn’t no c.playerRights= <0 or nothing
[/quote]What base are you using?[/quote]

In the title it says [PI] so im wondering, what base am I using?

Read full topic
